Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tile
  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    public class Tile The class Tile is a component in the Farmer class.

    The Tile class represents a unit of land in the Farmer's farmLot. It can be occupied with a Seed.

    This unit of land contains necessary info about the tile, including:
    States: isPlowed, isReady, isWithered, hasRocks, isAvailable
    Seed Information: waterCount, fertilizerCount, growingTime, occupant(Seed),
    and the pos, which represents the position of the tile in the farmLot.

    The pos variable is based on an arrayList position, at the same time considering a 10 by 5 layout in terms of a grid.

    Since:
    2018-08-15
    See Also:
    Seed, Farmer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile​(int pos)
        A constructor for objects of Tile class

        This costructor for this Tile is generally useful when instatiating multiple tiles in a for loop, which prevents repetition of the positions.

        Additionally, this contructor initially sets the occupant of the Tile to null, and sets it's isAvailable state to true, keeping the rest false.

        Parameters:
        pos - an integer which represents the position of the tile

    • Method Detail

      • displayStats

        public java.lang.String displayStats()
        Returns a string of text containing the Tile's information

        The string is formatted in such a way that it makes displaying information easier in the View class

        Returns:
        a string representation of the Tile's information

      • addWaterCount

        public void addWaterCount()
        Automatically adds 1 to the waterCount.

        This automatically adds 1 to the waterCount of the tile if the Seed occupant's waterMax is not reached yet. This method does nothing otherwise. This method is mainly called from the Farmer class hence the checking if there is an occupant for the tile is done on the Farmer.

      • addFertilizerCount

        public void addFertilizerCount()
        Automatically adds 1 to the fertilizerCount.

        This automatically adds 1 to the fertilizerCount of the tile if the Seed occupant's fertilizerMax is not reached yet. This method does nothing otherwise. This method is mainly called from the Farmer class hence the checking if there is an occupant for the tile is done on the Farmer.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Automatically returns the state of a tile to an unplowed tile.

        An unplowed tile is not plowed, not ready (for harvest), not withered, no rocks, and available. The waterCount and fertilizerCount is also set back to 0. The same goes for the growingTime. The occupant is also set to null.

      • isTree

        public boolean isTree()
        Checks if the current Seed occupant of the tile is an instance of the class FruitTree

        This method calls the instanceof operator and compares the occupant of the tile to the FruitTree class. This returns true if the seed is a FruitTree and returns false otherwise. It automatically returns false when there is no occupant in the tile.

        Returns:
        a boolean if the seed occupant of the tile is an instace of FruitTree.
        See Also:
        isVegetable(), isFlower()

      • isVegetable

        public boolean isVegetable()
        Checks if the current Seed occupant of the tile is an instance of the class Vegetable

        This method calls the instanceof operator and compares the occupant of the tile to the Vegetable class. This returns true if the seed is a Vegetable and returns false otherwise. It automatically returns false when there is no occupant in the tile.

        Returns:
        a boolean if the seed occupant of the tile is an instace of Vegetable.
        See Also:
        isTree(), isFlower()

      • isFlower

        public boolean isFlower()
        Checks if the current Seed occupant of the tile is an instance of the class Flower

        This method calls the instanceof operator and compares the occupant of the tile to the Flower class. This returns true if the seed is a Flower and returns false otherwise. It automatically returns false when there is no occupant in the tile.

        Returns:
        a boolean if the seed occupant of the tile is an instace of Flower.
        See Also:
        isTree(), isVegetable()

      • grownProperly

        public boolean grownProperly()
        Checks if the occupant of the tile has grown successfully

        This method checks the current waterCount and fertilizerCount of the tile. It then compares the values to the waterNeed and fertilizerNeed of the occupant. If any one of these values are less than their required amounts, the seed is said to have not grown properly and hence returns false. This returns true if both values matched or are greater than their counterparts.

        Returns:
        a boolean if the seed occupant of the tile has grown properly

      • setOccupant

        public void setOccupant​(Seed s)
        Sets the occupant of the tile to the specified seed.

        This method sets the occupant of the tile to the specified Seed s. This also sets the isAvailable variable of the tile to false, as it is now occupied. The growingTime of the tile is also set to the timeNeeded of the Seed s. It retrieves the value by calling the getter getTN() of the Seed class.

        Parameters:
        s - a seed which represents the occupant of the tile
